abstract: Nigerian election officials extend voting in some regions in the most contested election in country's post-independence history due to malfunctions in electronic registration machines; voters wait to cast their ballots as tensions mount amid fears that supporters of Pres Goodluck Jonathan and his challenger Muhammadu Buhari will clash regardless of outcome.
lead_paragraph: Dense crowds of people sometimes waited hours to vote on Saturday, and the election had to be extended to Sunday in parts of the country where machinery malfunctioned.

headline.main: Nigeria Votes in Sharply Contested Presidential Election
headline.print_headline: Starkly Divided, Nigerians Vote for a President

snippet: Dense crowds of people sometimes waited hours to vote on Saturday, and the election had to be extended to Sunday in parts of the country where machinery malfunctioned.
